metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10188 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: utility.c in telnetd in netkit telnet through 0.17 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via short writes or urgent data, because of a buffer overflow involving the netclear and nextitem functions.

notes.Note: ccdm94> in netkit-telnet, this CVE was patched in 0.17-18woody2. See https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=953477 for more information.

criterions.comment: inetutils: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
netkit-telnet: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
netkit-telnet-ssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
